name: Bitbucket Server Dark
description:
A dark theme specifically for Bitbucket Server installations. Don't expect it to play nice with bitbucket.org.

(Tested on Bitbucket Server v5.4.8 previously, and now on v6.6.1)
additional_info:
Changelog

  • v2.0.6(2020-03-05)
    • Merged the stylesheets for version 5 and 6 again. There will be only one for both from now on. This also means that the other style, Bitbucket Server 6 Dark, will be archived.
  • v2.0.5(2020-03-02)
    • Fixed an issue that was adding borders between every line on the side-by-side diff
    • Adapted to the possibility that some companies might still be using URLs that start with https://stash., despite the name change from Stash to Bitbucket Server having happened with the release of v4
  • v2.0.4(2019-12-20)
    • "Archived" this style in favour of BitBucket Server 6 Dark
      • (Not actually Archived as such, because it's pretty stable and people are still using Bitbucket Server v5. I just can't really maintain it anymore)
  • v2.0.3 (2019-04-09)
    • Fixed a bug on the Your Work screen
  • v2.0.2 (2019-03-18)
    • Fixed a few more missing elements
  • v2.0.1 (2018-11-14)
    • Added some styling for the fork sync merge strategy dialog
  • v2.0 (2018-11-12) Major update!
    • Added better support for alerts and messages
    • Styled the search screen
    • Tidied up several more missing elements
  • v1.4 (2018-06-15)
    • Styled the find bar on code screens (diffs and browsing source)
  • v1.3 (2018-06-01)
    • Improved on the URL matching to specifically exclude bitbucket.org
  • v1.2 (2018-05-01)
    • Added several more missing elements (dashboard, comments, messages...)
  • v1.1 (2018-03-08)
    • Added missing styles for rendered markdown (README.md, etc)
  • v1.0 (2018-03-07)
    • Initial version

discussions.name: Is there a way to remove these borders around the lines of code in the side-by-side diffs?
